title: Breaking news in South Yorkshire - BBC News
summary: doncaster 's tent city to be shut down by council .
nspcc says the football abuse scandal could be `` bigger than yewtree '' .
drop-in service for addicts opens in sheffield .
doncaster 's frances bishop is fired from the apprentice .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's it from me for this week .
kate will be back at 08:00 on monday with the latest news , travel , weather and sport for south yorkshire .
but before i go are five things we learned today :
let 's get a final look at the all important weekend weather with keeley :
a grotty , damp night with poor visibility .
but what about tomorrow ?
hope its better for stamford afc v sheffield fc on saturday 17th dec. at the zeeco stadium stamford .
what 's the outlook for christmas , will we need our umbrellas
@ twitterid grotty , damp ha only in yorkshire : )
no sunrise photos for me tomorrow , in the peak district , then ?
it sure was wet tonight 5 miles in the drizzle .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: teenager in court over shop death
text: teenager in court over shop death

documents.title: man dies after doncaster stabbing
text: a man who was stabbed at a house in doncaster last month has died in hospital .
the 26-year-old had been in a critical condition after the attack on surrey street in balby on the 15 november .
jonathan swift , 49 , from seaforth in liverpool has been charged with attempted murder and criminal damage by detectives investigating the incident .
he appeared at doncaster magistrates ' court last month .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield man has half his car stolen
text: a man from ranmoor in sheffield will miss christmas with his family after part of his car was stolen .
mike smith was called by the police this morning after they thought his car had been involved in an accident .
instead , he had just had part of his brand new vauxhall stolen :
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: teenager charged with sheffield murder
text: a 17-year-old boy has been charged with the murder of ahmed sayeed adan in sheffield last month .
the 40-year-old was attacked outside the emin supermarket on spital hill in the early hours of 20 november .
he died in hospital nine days later .
today the teenager appeared at sheffield youth court and was remanded in custody to appear at sheffield crown court next month .
a 19-year-old man remains on police bail in connection with the investigation .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster 'tent city ' being dismantled
text: doncaster 's `` tent city '' was being dismantled this afternoon .
it 's after the borough council obtained a court order to take back the land by the old civic theatre on waterdale .
doncaster council say everyone on the site has been offered accommodation and the authority 's chief executive , jo miller , says the camp has `` served its purpose '' .
no one needs to sleep rough or be homeless and our work as agencies to support those who need help it will continue . ''
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: tommy groome 's family 'devasted ' they ca n't lay him to rest
text: the family of tommy groome have given their reaction after his killer was convicted at sheffield crown court in a statement :
`` tommy was a much loved dad , son , brother , grandad and uncle .
we love and miss him so much .
he was a larger than life character who loved to travel and sing on the karaoke .
on the 1st january 2010 we said goodbye to him not knowing that this was the last time that we would see and speak to him .
throughout the last five years , we have hoped and prayed that tommy was still alive but our worst fears became a reality when we were told that tommy had been killed .
however , his body has still not been found .
we are devastated that we have been unable to lay him to rest in a place where we can visit and remember him and give him the funeral that he deserves .
we would like to thank everyone who has been involved or assisted in the investigation into the disappearance of tommy .
this includes the police in ireland , portugal and south yorkshire .
without them , we would never have known what happened to tommy . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: 'greed and revenge ' lay behind tommy groome 's murder
text: prosecutors say `` greed and revenge '' was the reason for the murder of doncaster man tommy groome .
jason thaxter , 39 , was found guilty of the 53-year-old 's murder at sheffield crown court today .
senior crown prosecutor mark langan said thaxter and his mother june buttle , who was tommy groome 's partner , wove a `` tangled web of lies and deception '' to cover up the murder .
he added in a statement :
the cps was able to call two witnesses who told the court that june buttle had confessed to killing tommy groome .
she told one witness in some detail how she and her son had dismembered his body and disposed of it on a bonfire .
their motive was a combination of greed after mr groome had been awarded a substantial sum of compensation and revenge for the violence which had been a prominent feature of their relationship .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: friday night 's bbl actionsheffield sharks v leeds force ( 19:30 gmt )
text: bbl action continues across the bbc this evening as sheffield sharks welcome leeds force to the english institute of sport .
both yorkshire sides sit towards the bottom end of the table in the british basketball league , with the sharks in sixth and force in tenth .

you can watch all the action live on the bbc sport website , app and selected connected tv 's from 19:30 gmt by clicking here and if you want to learn more about the bbc 's coverage from the bbl and wbbl in 2016/2017 click here .

documents.title: doncaster man guilty of tommy groome murder
text: a man from hexthorpe has been found guilty of murdering his mother 's partner six years ago .
jason thaxter , 39 , was convicted of murder and conspiracy to prevent a burial at sheffield crown court .
thaxter 's mother , june buttle from doncaster , is currently serving 16 years in prison after admitting tommy groome 's manslaughter last year .
she also admitted charges of conspiracy to prevent a burial and fraud against tommy groome 's estate .
thaxter has been remanded in custody and will be sentenced on monday .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield schoolchildren collect more than 20 bags of litter
text: pupils at a sheffield primary school have collected more than 20 bags of litter .
children at shortbrook primary school cleaned up their westfield neighbourhood as part of keep britain tidy 's love where you live '' .
they have also had a competition to design a poster which will be put on the city 's litter bins , which was won by 11-year-old ruby graham burke :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster tent city : 'the job has been done '
text: doncaster council 's chief executive jo miller has been speaking to me about the town 's `` tent city '' .
the authority has been given a court order to take back the land on waterdale where the site has been operating for the past month .
the council boss says she feels `` the job has been done '' .
of the 80 people at the site , jo miller says half have been housed and the other half were either not homeless or refused offers of help .
she added that she hopes the site will not move to another location as help is available from authorities .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: breakingbody found in river don confirmed as missing rotherham man
text: a body found in the river don on tuesday has been confirmed as missing rotherham man daniel higgs .
the 32-year-old was reported missing last month .
his family have been informed and are receiving support from specialist police officers .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: 'space pie ' returns from final frontier
text: 'space pie ' returns from final frontier

documents.title: doncaster 'tent city ' organisers given until tomorrow to leave
text: the organisers behind doncaster 's so-called `` tent city '' have been given until tomorrow morning to shut it down .
doncaster council has been granted a court order to take back the land by the old civic theatre on waterdale which has housed the homeless camp for the past month .
the authority has told organisers it will not take enforcement action until 10:00 tomorrow .
organiser philip hartley has praised doncaster council 's efforts to house the homeless and said those left on the site have refused help from authorities .
however he did point out that the council was refused an injunction stopping the site moving saying that those left had a `` legal right '' to move the tents somewhere else .
the people it was there to help have been helped . ''
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: new campaign in sheffield to protect vulnerable people from rogue traders
text: a new campaign has been launched in sheffield to protect vulnerable people from rogue traders .
sheffield trading standards estimates more than 600 residents are being targeted by scam mail .
it says at least half those victims lose more than £ 50 to fraud , while 5 % lose more than £ 5,000 .
the `` not born yesterday '' campaign brings together the city council , police and charities .
if you are concerned about rogue traders or scam mail you can contact sheffield trading standards on 03454 040506 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: brodsworth hall all lit up for christmas
text: yesterday i went for a sneak peek at brodsworth hall 's christmas lights .
the enchanted christmas garden at the country house opens to the public tonight .
they 're using a glitter ball to light up the front of the mansion :
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your lunchtime headlines
text: let 's take a look at the stories making the news across south yorkshire this lunchtime :
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingdoncaster council granted court order to take back 'tent city ' land
text: doncaster council has been granted a possession order to take back land being used as a tent city to house the homeless .
the site on land by the old civic theatre in waterdale has been used by campaigners since last month .
doncaster council told doncaster county court they did not intend to apply for costs from the campaigners .
however , the court decided not to grant the authority an injunction preventing the camp from moving to other sites in the town centre .
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: cctv image released after alleged sex assault on doncaster bus
text: a cctv image has been released after an alleged sexual assault on a 15-year-old girl travelling on a bus in doncaster .
the girl was on an 87 bus from the frenchgate interchange going towards stainforth on saturday 15 october , when a man sat behind her started stroking her hair .
police want to speak to the man in the image below who they believe was on the same bus .
anyone who can help is asked to call south yorkshire police on 101 or crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather : staying cloudy and mild
text: it 's a cloudy day across south yorkshire but do n't expect much change .
it will also stay mild this afternoon .
i have a full forecast for you below :
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: new network launched to honour mexborough poet
text: a new network has been launched to honour poet ted hughes who spent his childhood in mexborough near doncaster .
the ted hughes network has been launched at the university of huddersfield .
the new network involves the ted hughes society , the elmet trust and the ted hughes project ( south yorkshire ) .
one goal of the group is to secure funding for a yorkshire-wide ted hughes literary and heritage trail .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire 's best christmas jumpers
text: did you know it 's christmas jumper day today ?
i donned my light-up festive top and set myself a target to take `` elfies '' with 100 people .
here are some of the best christmas jumpers i 've seen this morning :
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: no guarantees of no disruption if sheffield central library deal goes ahead
text: plans to turn sheffield central library into a five star hotel have been discussed .
at a meeting last night the council said it ca n't guarantee there 'll be no disruption to the service if the library moves .
a petition against the proposals has gathered more than 10,000 signatures .
a further public meeting about the council 's plans will take place at the town hall tonight .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: doncaster 's defeated apprentice candidate calls for 'indie retail ' support
text: frances bishop is on her way home to doncaster .
it 's after the boutique owner failed to make it through to the final two in the apprentice .
she 's been on twitter this morning and is calling for more support for independent traders :
thank you .
indie retail deserves more recognition .
that 's what the high streets need .
not more phillip greens
my first job was an indie sweet shop , was shocked by how rude/blunt fellow staff members were when i also got a high street job
well said , frances .
well done to get that far on the apprentice too .
agree completely .
i miss my business and what it stood for .
if you ever need more staff , let me know loved watching you .
unfortunately , the internet & bargain hunters killed my shoe shop.i think children 's clothes has a different sort of customer .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: let 's take a look at the top stories in south yorkshire :
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : charity single released in memory of yorkshire mp jo cox
text: a charity single recorded in memory of the murdered yorkshire mp jo cox is released today .
a group of music stars and mps have covered `` you ca n't always get what you want '' by the rolling stones .
sales of the single will raise money for the jo cox fund .
the appeal has raised almost £ 2m in memory of the politician , who was murdered in june .
author: BBC Look North

documents.title: you 're fired ! doncaster contestant out of the apprentice
text: doncaster 's frances bishop is out of the apprentice .
the clothing boutique owner was fired by lord sugar last night .
frances failed to get through a gruelling set of interviews and is heading back to yorkshire .
you can watch the apprentice on the bbc iplayer .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster 's 'tent city ' set to be shut down
text: a tent city for the homeless which has been set up in doncaster is set to close today .
doncaster council is going to court to get an order to take back the land by the old civic theatre in waterdale .
the authority says that although the camp has done good work since it was set up last month , it is now becoming a `` magnet '' for homeless people from outside the borough .
campaigners say they are working on getting the last few people on the site housed but have also said they are considering setting up a second site at another location in doncaster .
author: Tom Ingall
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : new drop-in service for addicts opens in sheffield
text: a new drop-in service in sheffield officially opened yesterday helping drink and drug addicts get clean .
the sheffield recovery community is running weekly sessions at de hood in city road on thursdays between 16:00 and 20:00 .
i went along to meet some of the organisers :
@ sheffrecovery2 offer drop-ins for drug & alcohol addicts .
i 've been to see them .
my full report on @ twitterid breakfast tomorrow .
author: Joshua Cook
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: football abuse scandal 'bigger than yewtree '
text: we 've been talking about the football abuse scandal this morning .
it comes after it was confirmed that three historical abuse cases are being investigated by south yorkshire police .
the clubs involved in the cases have not been identified .
a national helpline set up by the nspcc has had more than 1,700 calls in the past three weeks - an unprecedented number .
speaking to bbc radio sheffield mike hanning from the charity said the football abuse scandal could be bigger than operation yewtree , the investigation started after the jimmy savile abuse claims .
andy woodward said it might be bigger than yewtree .
unfortunately at the moment he 's been proved correct . ''
if you have been affected by this story you can contact the nspcc 's dedicated football abuse line on 0800 023 2642 .
author: BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cloud , drizzle , sunny spells and staying mild
text: we 've got a mix of conditions expected today .
it 'll be mostly cloudy but there 's a chance of showers and if you 're lucky - some sunny spells !
i have a full forecast for you below :
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : latest updates for south yorkshire
text: good morning , it 's kevin here .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for south yorkshire .
it 's beginning to feel a bit more festive out there , so why not take a look at this shot of enchanted christmas garden at brodsworth hall which opened last night :
if you 've got a story or a photo to share , we 'd love to hear from you .
why not tweet us on @ bbcsheffield or drop us an e-mail ?
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: five things we learnt today
text: that 's it from me for today .
we 'll continue to keep you updated overnight with the latest news and travel updates .
i 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with the latest for south yorkshire .
here are five things we learnt today :
but before i go take a look at this sneak peek of the christmas lights at brodsworth hall which has put me in the mood for a mince pie and a glass of mulled wine :

BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cloudy with rain dying out overnight
text: it 's been a murky old day across south yorkshire .
the good news is any rain is set to die out during the evening leaving a mostly cloudy night .
it 'll also stay relatively mild for the time of year :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man jailed for 'cowardly ' bed killing
text: man jailed for 'cowardly ' bed killing

documents.title: watch : sheffield space pie flight
text: a team from sheffield have sent a pie into space for what 's believed to be the first time .
sent into space put the pie into flight at the world pie eating championships in wigan .
they 've sent us a video of the pie-neering trip :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: your afternoon headlines
text: let 's take a look at the stories making the news in south yorkshire this afternoon :
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: pastry case space race latest
text: three two one lift off !
a team from sheffield have launched a pie into space .
the first known pastry space flight happened in wigan this morning .
the team from sent into space launched the pie out of the atmosphere at the world pie eating championships in wigan .
but just like fellow space traveller e.t .
the pie is expected to head `` home '' over the pennines back to yorkshire .
watch your head !
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: major employer to stay in doncaster
text: a financial firm which employs more than 300 people in doncaster has said it will stay in the town .
close brothers motor finance which has been based in the borough since 1991 has signed a new lease on its headquarters ,
doncaster is a true 'commuter-city ' and the local road infrastructure , rail links and surrounding airports make the city a hotbed for business activity . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield surgeon to trek across the south pole
text: sheffield nhs surgeon ghazala ahmad-mear is planning to walk 60 miles through the south pole in january 2018 .
her campaign stepbystep is part of a 600-mile expedition called the south pole energy challenge .
it is being led by robert swan , the first person to walk to both the north and south poles .
mrs ahmad-mear has to raise more than £ 60,000 ahead of her trip where she will face temperatures of -20c and blizzards .
the walk is the first to be powered by renewable energy using technology from nasa .
author: Robert Baguley
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: new campaign to encourage doncaster pregnant women to quit smoking
text: a new campaign has been launched to encourage mums-to-be in doncaster to quit smoking .
the `` quit for you , quit for two '' campaign from health trust rdash is emphasising how much money pregnant women can save by giving up .
smoking in pregnancy advisors estimate that someone who smokes 20 cigarettes per day can save £ 392 in seven weeks .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: let 's take a look at the top stories across south yorkshire this lunchtime :
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: it 's a bit foggy out there !
text: it 's a grey and grim day out there .
this photo from our bbc weather watcher the wendy house sums it up !
do n't forget your torch !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police investigate magna bomb hoax
text: police have launched an investigation into a bomb hoax at magna .
hundreds of people were evacuated and roads were shut for several hours on tuesday .
the bomb squad were called out and the package was discovered to be a hoax .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: missing sheffield woman found in kent
text: a sheffield woman who has been missing since tuesday has been found .
59 year old carol worthington has been found in kent .
missing # sheffield woman carol worthington found in kent .
thank you for sharing the appeal !
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield eagles to move to wakefield
text: sheffield eagles rugby league club will have to play some matches in wakefield next year .
the club has been without a permanent home since the 2013 demolition of the don valley stadium .
the move to wakefield is subject to approval by the sport 's governing body .
the club had hoped to eventually move into the olympic legacy park in attercliffe but mr aston said delays are damaging the club 's ability to attract investors .
sheffield city council said the club had been told the pitch at the olympic park would be available for most of their 2017 games .
it 's a crying shame we ca n't get the support in our hour of need . ''
author: Ronan Sully
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: brodsworth hall lit up for christmas
text: i 've been for a sneak peek as brodsworth hall puts up its christmas lights .
the country house near doncaster is getting its lights ready ahead of their big switch-on tomorrow night .
you can go and see them until the 23 december .
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'bare legs brian ' gets his pins out again
text: do you remember `` bare legs brian '' from greenhill in sheffield ?
he got his legs out by wearing shorts for a year in order to raise money to fight motor neurone disease .
now he 's doing it again - with the help of some sheffield tartan :
you 'll have to pay £ 1 to look under his kilt though - all money raised goes to the motor neurone disease association .
watch out for gusts brian !
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: missing sheffield woman may be in scarborough
text: the search for missing sheffield woman carol worthington has been extended to north yorkshire .
police believe the 59-year-old may now be in scarborough .
carol was last seen at 08:30 on tuesday morning in the newfield green area of sheffield .
anyone with information is asked to call south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cloudy with a chance of rain this afternoon
text: there 's a chance of rain this afternoon but the good news is the mild temperatures are staying with us .
i 've got a full forecast for you below :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: sheffield sharks swim on to bbc coverage
text: the sheffield sharks are preparing for tomorrow 's basketball derby against leeds at the english institute of sport .
for the first time you 'll be able to see the game on the bbc .
i spoke to sharks head coach atiba lyons about the new deal and the yorkshire derby :
point guard jordan davis is back after an ankle injury and new signing kellen thornton will make his debut .
you can watch the game live via the bbc sport website from 19:30 tomorrow .
author: Jamie Campbell
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: let 's talk christmas - but not what you might expect !
text: i 'm talking christmas this morning .
a lot of you are asking whether we 'll see a white christmas this year - it 's still too soon to say i 'm afraid !
but i do have a little christmas surprise in my video for you :
i 'm talking christmas today 's forecast and my festive socks coming up .
me all morning , @ twitterid @ twitterid
when you tweet owain , , , ,it brightens the drearyest of days you are summer in darkest winter , ,
love festive socks
always cheers my moring up , love the socks
good morning
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after crash shuts m1 and m18
text: a man has been airlifted to hospital after a collision involving a lorry and a van on a south yorkshire motorway .
the man 's injuries have been described by south yorkshire police as 'potentially serious ' .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: sheffield council official moves on to lincolnshire
text: sheffield council 's head of place simon green , who is responsible for the streets ahead contract , is moving on .
he is taking up a new post at north lincolnshire council .
simon green played a key role in the controversial felling of trees in sheffield .
simon has been with the council for many years and played an important role in the city 's impressive regeneration ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: south yorkshire police issues statement on historical football abuse
text: south yorkshire police has issued a statement after a meeting revealed the force is investigating three cases .
the incidents are said to have happened in the 1960s and 1980s but the clubs involved have n't been named .
the force has just issued the following statement :
south yorkshire police is one of a number of forces across the country currently reviewing reports of non-recent child abuse within the football community . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: eight arrests after rotherham police operation
text: eight people have been arrested on separate offences after a day of action by police in rotherham .
operation duxford lasted for 18 hours and saw several police operations linked with education and community awareness campaigns .
south yorkshire police say as a result of operation duxford £ 33,000 worth of cannabis plants were seized when eight warrants were issued .
separately , four men were arrested over firearms offences .
operation duxford in rotherham has helped facilitate an exchange of information and the building of trust in the police . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: breakingsouth yorkshire police investigate three football abuse claims
text: south yorkshire police has confirmed it has had three reports of historical child sexual abuse related to football clubs in the county .
the complaints are said to relate to incidents in the 1960s and 1980s .
the force confirmed the reports in response to a question from deputy police and crime commissioner sioned-mair richards at a public accountability board meeting .
the clubs involved have not been named .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: follow @ twitterid on instagram
text: are you on instagram ?
why not follow us @ twitterid for daily stunning images of our region ?
you can tag your posts # bbcyorkshire for a chance to be featured too .

documents.title: travel : all lanes re-open on m1 after earlier collision
text: all lanes on the m1 have re-opened after an earlier collision although long delays remain .
get the latest bbc travel news for south yorkshire
all lanes have reopened # m1 s/b btwn j32 + j31 following an earlier collision .
long delays on approach back to j34 # sheffield .
pls take care
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: your morning headlines
text: let 's take a look at the top stories in south yorkshire this morning :
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: how you can help sheffield 's homeless
text: people in sheffield are being told not to give money to street beggars as it encourages people to stay on the streets .
sheffield council estimate half the people they find on the streets on any night will have accommodation they have turned down .
the other half may have previously been kicked out or left a shelter .
in many cases people are suffering from long-term mental health conditions , chronic alcohol or drug abuse .
many of you have contacted us wanting to find out how you can help homeless people in the city .
the rough sleeper team are asking people not to give money direct , but instead to give money to homeless charities like the archer project or turning point .
if you find someone who says they have nowhere to go and you are worried , you can call sheffield 's rough sleeper service on 0114 263 6964 .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: travel : m18 re-opens after collision but delays continue
text: we 've just had an update on the issues on the m18 and m1 .
get the latest bbc travel news for south yorkshire
# m1 + # m18 s/b reopened following earlier collision , 2 lanes remain closed # m1 s/b between j32 + j31 # sheffield .
delays on both approaches
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: one small step for man , one giant leap for pastry
text: get ready mission control , stand by with the hendo 's .
a team from sheffield is getting ready to blast a pie into space to `` test it 's molecular structure '' .
luis cox from sheffield firm sent into space showed me the pie in the sky ahead of its launch :
unfortunately , cape canaveral and houston were booked up so it 's being launched in wigan !
the launch takes place at 11:30 at the world pie eating championships .
we 'll keep you updated on this pie-oneering experiment .
author: Kat Cowan
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'do n't give money to street beggars ' sheffield council warns
text: i 've been out with the team in sheffield which counts the number of homeless in the city every year .
this year , sheffield had 15 people compared to 11 people last year .
the authorities are asking us not to give money to those begging on the street - saying it does n't help .
the city council says the generosity of kind-hearted people in sheffield is keeping people on the streets .
do n't give money .
not that you ca n't help .
you can help by giving to registered charities . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: sheffield researchers develop new bra to help breast cancer patients
text: researchers at sheffield hallam university are working with a lingerie company to develop a new type of bra .
it could help in the treatment of women with breast cancer .
the garment is being designed to improve the accuracy of radiotherapy and improve patient dignity .
author: BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : sheffield children put their advent calendars into reverse
text: i 've been finding out about an unusual idea for christmas - a reverse advent calendar !
instead of opening a door and getting a present , they 're giving gifts to others .
each day a different child brings in a item to go in hampers which will go to nearby charity the carmel care centre .
author: Ronan Sully
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cloudy but the mild weather continues
text: well it 's not looking much like a ty december scene at the moment .
that 's set to continue as the mild weather stays with us .
it 'll be cloudy for most of the day with a chance of showers this afternoon .
i 've got a full forecast for you below :

Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: travel : severe disruption on m1 southbound near bramley
text: there is some severe disruption on the m1 southbound this morning with three lanes closed .
it 's closed between junction 32 for m18 and junction 31 for the a57 after a multi-vehicle accident .
get the latest bbc travel for south yorkshire
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : latest updates for south yorkshire
text: good morning , it 's kevin here .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport for south yorkshire .
did you see the amazing moon last night ?
it really impressed me .
but not as much as this photo from our weather watcher the wild garden of the moon over sheffield .
if you 've got a story or a photo to share we 'd love to hear from you .
why not tweet us on @ twitterid or drop us an e-mail ?
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: yorkshire appoint england test batsman ballance as new captain
text: yorkshire have appointed gary ballance as their new captain after andrew gale retired to become head coach .
the 27-year-old england batsman will skipper the side in all three formats of the game .
ballance said : `` it is an absolute honour to be named the club captain and to follow in the footsteps of some great captains over the years .
`` it was impossible to turn down .
being captain is something that i enjoy doing and hopefully i will do a good job . ''
the zimbabwe-born batsman joined yorkshire from derbyshire in 2007 and helped them win back-to-back county championship titles in 2014 and 2015 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: five things we learnt today
text: that 's it from me for today .
we 'll continue to keep you updated overnight with the latest news and travel updates .
i 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with the latest for south yorkshire .
here are five things we learnt today :
but before i go - have a look at this tweet from sheffield children 's hospital which made me smile earlier today :
we just had a very special visit from the one and only mickey mouse !
our patients loved meeting him !
@ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather : a dry and mild night ahead
text: it 's been a nice sunny day across south yorkshire ,
it 's also been mild and that will continue throughout the night - although it will cloud over after dark .
i 've got a full forecast for you below :

Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: barnsley council launch campaign to tackle domestic abuse
text: a new campaign against domestic abuse has been launched in barnsley .
the speak up campaign highlights that domestic abuse is not just about violence but can extend to psychological and emotional harm .
if you are affected by these issues you can contact pathways on 01226 731 812 or 07710 597037 .
you can also contact south yorkshire police on 101 or if you are in immediate danger on 999 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: get a look at this belting busker in sheffield !
text: i was wandering through sheffield city centre this lunchtime when i came across this busker .
you 'll want the sound turned up to watch this amazing performance !
hoorah for the christmas busker .
haha saw him on friday .
legend !
we had him in leeds last week , what a legend
author: Katrina Bunker
Editor, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: seven arson attacks in eight weeks at doncaster parks
text: police are asking for help to find those responsible for a series of arsons at parks in doncaster .
playgrounds in rossington have been targeted with one on atlee lane so badly damaged the equipment had to be removed .
police are asking anyone with information to contact them on 101 .
alternatively you can call crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
fires put lives at risk and this senseless vandalism must stop . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: syrian community hold aleppo protest in sheffield
text: there 's been a demonstration outside the town hall in sheffield today .
it 's in support of syrian children who are being killed in the conflict .
the demonstration has been organised by the syrian association of yorkshire :
syrian community coming together sheffield centre .
solidarity # syria
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Radio Sheffield

BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: man dies after rotherham car crash
text: a man has died after a car crash in rotherham .
the 42-year-old lost his life after his mitsubishi evolution car went into a wall on hollings lane near to the quarry grange yesterday .
the man passed away at the scene and was pronounced dead by paramedics .
his family have been informed .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Radio Sheffield

the groups funded are :

documents.title: doncaster christmas concert with a difference !
text: it 's the time of year for children across south yorkshire to melt our hearts with their christmas carols .
but this venue is a bit different than a school or village hall .
the children from thornhill junior school performed their christmas songs at doncaster station - you can watch them below :
check out these great singers from thornhill junior school at doncaster !
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield woman hosts christmas lunch for the lonely
text: i 've been down to a christmas party with a difference .
sheffield woman gloria stewart is cooking lunch for more than 400 people - fortunately not on her own !
she 's hosting a christmas lunch at niagra police social club in hillsborough for those who will be on their own on the big day .
gloria 's hosted the event ever since she lost her mum on christmas day in 1991 , as she wanted a happy occasion to remember her .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: search for missing sheffield woman
text: have you seen missing carol worthington from sheffield ?
the 59-year-old has n't been seen since around 08:30 yesterday in the newfield green area .
police say they are increasingly concerned for her welfare .
anyone with information is asked to contact south yorkshire police on 101 .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

you can tag your posts # bbcyorkshire for a chance to be featured .

Journalist, BBC Local Live

documents.title: rotherham taxi drivers lose appeal bid
text: a group of rotherham taxi drivers have lost an appeal against new rules that require them to install a taxi camera in their vehicles .
the eight drivers lodged the appeal at sheffield magistrates court after rotherham council introduced the policy in july .
the new rules affect 700 vehicles in rotherham .
the court heard claims from the drivers that the cameras were too expensive , and the camera specification was too complicated .

the district judge dismissed the appeal stating he was `` not satisfied '' the drivers had made the case that the condition requiring them to install a taxi camera was unreasonable , adding that the drivers ' case appeared `` confused and contradictory '' .
the eight drivers have been ordered to pay costs of £ 525 each .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: art project raises the issue of destitution in doncaster
text: i 've been speaking to les monaghan , who 's an artist from doncaster .
his new project features those living in poverty and struggling to pay fuel bills and put food on the table .
one of his images features `` dave '' who showed les all the money he had on 28 november .
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: what do you get your pet for christmas ?
text: well i 've had an education this morning .
we found out yesterday that people are buying their pets presents for christmas .
but the question was left unanswered - what do you get them ?
wonder no longer !
we 've taken a look at some of the top gifts for your furry friend this festive season :
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: £ 15,420 raised for charity at doncaster 's dragon boat race
text: doncaster 's dragon boat race has become an annual fixture on the calendar for local businesses .
firms compete in dragon boats at lakeside in july to raise money for charity .
now the totals are in and the event raised £ 15,420 for charities which will be shared out by the doncaster rotary club .
the planning is already underway for next year 's event on the 15 july .
the dragon boat event raised a huge £ 15,420 for charity !
thank you and well done to all involved : # doncasterisgreat
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

text: it 's a nice and sunny morning across south yorkshire .
the mild weather we 've been enjoying recently is staying with us as well .
i have a full forecast for you below :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: new artwork unveiled at st paul 's place in sheffield
text: new stonework has been unveiled at st paul 's place in sheffield .
the new office development in the city centre will be home to handelsbanken and arup .
the artwork has been inspired by sheffield 's hidden rivers .
artist richard perry also made the bronze sculpture of thomas boulsover in tudor square .
i like the building i have been working on , i like its elegance and the way the three st paul 's place buildings are massed . ''
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: yorkshire ukip mep criticises eu army plans
text: a yorkshire mep has criticised plans for an eu army .
ukip 's mike hookem has spoken in a debate at the european parliament .
he says `` not one penny '' of british taxpayers money should be spent on the european defence force .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: mp to meet transport secretary on airport future
text: a doncaster mp is due to meet the transport secretary later to discuss the future of doncaster sheffield airport .
caroline flint will sit down with chris grayling to talk about our regional airport which sits in her don valley constituency .
it comes after the airport unveiled ambitious expansion plans yesterday .
the airport is calling for a station on the east coast main line which could allow it to have 25 million passengers a year by 2037 .
that 's as big as manchester airport is now .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley to consider 'residents only ' permits for tips
text: barnsley council is considering introducing `` residents only '' permits for its tips .
the authority says restricted opening hours and closures in sheffield , doncaster and rotherham mean more people are travelling to barnsley to dispose of their rubbish .
the council has discovered the problem after people were asked for id when going to the dump .
councillors are due to decide whether to go ahead with the plans later today .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: unemployment falls in yorkshire and the humber
text: fewer people are out of work in yorkshire and the humber .
new figures show that unemployment in the region fell by 15,000 between august and october to 144,000 .
nationally , the jobless total stands at 1.62 million after a reduction of 16,000 in the quarter to october - that 's a 10-year low .

documents.title: wentworth and dearne mp launches campaign to end rough sleeping
text: wentworth and dearne mp john healey has launched a new labour campaign to end rough sleeping .
the shadow housing secretary is calling for an end to people sleeping in doorways and on park benches .
labour says the number of rough sleepers has doubled since 2010 .
ministers say government funding for homelessness over the next four years has been increased to £ 139m .
the rapidly rising number of people sleeping in doorways and on park benches shames us all .
there can be no excuses - it must end .
full stop . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

trains between chesterfield and sheffield are now able to run normally following a lorry colliding with a railway bridge .

documents.title: barnsley fruit and veg voucher scheme launched
text: food vouchers are to be given to up to 120 families as part of a scheme aimed at encouraging people to eat more fruit and veg .
about £ 30,000 worth of vouchers will be given to people to buy fruit and vegetables at barnsley market .
the pilot , funded by the big lottery fund and the alexandra rose charity , is the first outside of london .
the vouchers will help them develop the skills and confidence to provide their families with the healthiest start . ''
author: Mick Lunney
Barnsley Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

text: the build up continues ahead tonight 's south yorkshire derby between sheffield wednesday and barnsley .
the championship match at hillsborough kicks off at 19:45 with full coverage on football heaven .
owls head coach carlos carvalhal spoke to bbc radio sheffield before the game :

BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: care home provider pulls out of council contracts
text: the second largest home care provider in the uk , the mears group , say they ca n't afford to provide care services on the money they 're being paid .
they have pulled out of three contracts with local authorities and say more could follow .
the company is known to have a contract with sheffield city council and rotherham council but neither authority says they have been contacted by the firm .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingbody found in search for missing rotherham man
text: police searching for missing rotherham man daniel higgs have found a body .
officers found a man 's body in the river don at 10:55 .
the body has not been identified but is believed to be the missing 32 year old .
daniel 's family have been informed and are being supported by specialist officers .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: families to get fruit and veg vouchers
text: families to get fruit and veg vouchers

documents.title: man arrested in connection with attempted rape on sheffield train
text: a 33 year old man has been arrested by detectives investigating an attempted rape on a train out of sheffield station .
on 19th november a 27 year old woman and her partner were on the 22:40 train from sheffield to leeds .
when her partner went to the toilet a man sat next to the woman and attempted to rape her .
on his return the partner threw the man out of the seat but was unaware of what had happened to the woman until the couple got off the train at swinton .
a 33 year old barnsley man was arrested by british transport police on saturday .
he has been bailed until the 20th january as detectives continue their investigation .
anyone with information is asked to contact police on 0800 40 50 40 .
incidents of this nature on the railway network are rare , and it is vital that we establish the exact circumstances of what happened. ``
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire derby : barnsley boss previews the match
text: there 's a south yorkshire derby this evening .
it 's sheffield wednesday against barnsley in the championship .
reds boss paul heckingbottom has been speaking to bbc radio sheffield ahead of the match :
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: £ 12,000 worth of cannabis plants seized in rotherham drugs raids
text: police have seized 12 cannabis plants worth £ 12,000 as well as cash in a series of raids in rotherham .
officers from south yorkshire police made one arrest after carrying out warrants at three addresses in the town .
it was part of a day of action involving more than 150 police and other agency staff known as operation duxford .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: taxi licensing powers return to rotherham council
text: rotherham council will get back powers over taxi licensing - gradually .
the government has decided to return powers to the appointed commissioners who run many council functions .
however , elected councillors will not take over the responsibility for taxi licensing until 2019 .
i 've asked the commissioners to continue to keep a watchful eye over the decisions that are taken . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: workers allowed back into magna after bomb scare
text: workers have been let back into the magna centre in rotherham after a suspect package was made safe .
the bomb squad was called in after police were alerted to the item which was in a road near the visitor attraction .
about 650 people who were attending a conference at magna had to leave the building while the incident was dealt with .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your reaction to 'transformational ' plans for doncaster sheffield airport
text: doncaster sheffield airport have revealed big plans to develop over the next twenty years .
but what do you think about their plans to become as big as manchester airport by 2037 ?

BBC Radio Sheffield

Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster mp calls on goverment to help save steel firm
text: the government is being urged to intervene to stop a steel company in doncaster from going under .
noel village foundry , based in balby , is struggling in the face of changing demand and cheap foreign competition .
the labour mp for doncaster central , rosie winterton raised the issue in the commons with business secretary greg clark :

documents.title: 500 people waiting for coaches to sheffield after magna bomb scare
text: 500 people are waiting for coaches to take them to sheffield after a sus package was found at magna .
they were attending a conference at the venue when the alert was raised .
they are now being taken to their firms in sheffield until the situation is resolved .
buses called in to help move people after magna was evacuated this morning .
roads in the area still closed @ twitterid
is there any update ?
work nearby are the roads still closed ?
police have told us that the cordon has been lifted
they were buses to help us kier workers who were having a meeting at magna at the time , and was stranded .
thanks craig - i spoke to one of your colleagues this morning .
glad everyone 's safe

BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your headlines for south yorkshire
text: let 's take a look at the top stories making the news in south yorkshire today :

BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: magna bomb scare : eyewitness talks about evacuation
text: i 'm down at magna where nearby roads have been closed off after a sus package was found .
the bomb squad are on their way from chester and are expected to arrive in a couple of hours .
i spoke to tim who was evacuated when the device was found just after 09:00 .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingsus package found at magna
text: the magna centre in rotherham has been evacuated after a sus package was found .
sheffield road has been closed between the ickles way junction and the st lawrence road junction because of the incident .
south yorkshire police have said in a statement :
`` a cordon is currently in place on temple road , rotherham after police received reports of a possible sus package at around 9.00am this morning .
the site and surrounding areas have been secured and police are currently liaising with the eod ( explosive ordinance disposal ) unit .
sheffield road and temple road have both been closed . ''
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingdoncaster 's tent city set to be closed down on friday
text: doncaster 's tent city is set to be closed down later this week .
doncaster council is taking court action on friday at 11am at doncaster county court to try and shut down the camp on waterdale .
the authority says it has identified 60 homeless people living at tent city and helped 43 of them , while the others refused assistance .
now , doncaster council 's chief executive says tent city is acting as a `` magnet '' for homeless people outside of doncaster and so the council says it needs to take action .
we have come to the view that tent city itself is no longer sustainable and we must bring this to a resolution . ''
last night in a facebook live video , doncaster tent city organiser philip hartley criticised council-funded services .
he also stated that organisers have a second location in mind where they could move the camp .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: look north 's paul hudson pays tribute to weatherman mccaskill
text: look north 's paul hudson has paid tribute to former tv weather forecaster ian mccaskill , who 's died aged 78 .
mr mccaskill , who had been living with dementia for the past five years , lived in a care home in south milford near selby .
paul hudson , bbc look north 's weather presenter , who co-wrote the book frozen in time with mr mccaskill , said he was `` really sorry '' to hear of his death .
`` we had great fun writing our book frozen in time .
a warm , funny , generous and kind man , '' he added .

documents.title: watch : doncaster sheffield airport boss talks about 'transformational ' plans
text: we 're talking about the big plans for doncaster sheffield airport to become as big as manchester airport .
they 're hoping plans for a station on the east coast mainline could allow them to have 25 million passengers a year by 2037 .
i spoke to steve gill , managing director of doncaster sheffield airport about the proposals :
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : quarter of a million mince pies in barnsley !
text: i 'm at potts family bakery in barnsley this morning .
they 're a fifth generation bakers and have been making mince pies since 1891 .
they 're now busy making a quarter of a million mince pies in time for christmas .
i 've been down for a look - and a taste !
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield has highest rates of female genital mutilation in yorkshire
text: a bbc investigation 's revealed there have been more cases of female genital mutilation reported in sheffield than anywhere else in yorkshire .

female genital mutilation mainly affects women from an african or middle eastern background but there 's evidence to show illegal operations , which can leave girls with life changing injuries and infertility , are happening in britain as well as abroad .
we 've spoken to one victim living here in south yorkshire .
warning : you may find some of what she told us disturbing :
author: Jenny Eells
BBC Yorkshire

documents.title: doncaster fracking test well could be drilled in the new year
text: a test well which could eventually lead to fracking coming to our area could be drilled in the new year .
planning approval was given to the proposals by the company igas to drill at misson near doncaster in november .
thirty-seven planning conditions are being added to minimise the impact on the local community who have campaigned against the proposals .
nottinghamshire county council says that the legal formalities will be completed by the end of january .
that would then allow igas to begin the drilling on the test well .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: man arrested after doncaster charity box theft
text: a man has been arrested by police investigating the theft of a charity box in doncaster .
the collection was taken from the children 's centre on woodfield plantation in balby .
the man was arrested nearby and will be interviewed by officers later .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: big expansion plans for robin hood airport
text: doncaster sheffield airport has been revealing big expansion plans .
they want to be as big as manchester airport by 2037 with 25 million passengers passing through their doors .
they 'll do it by pushing for a station on the east coast mainline with another on the doncaster-lincoln line .
with the work to improve road links which started with the opening of the great yorkshire way earlier this year there would be big boost to their catchment area .
there would also be a lot of development around the airport , including a new aero centre innovation district which would boost jobs .
the detailed report into the proposals will be launched in the new year .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Radio Sheffield

that 's because the mild weather is staying with us , but it 'll stay cloudy throughout the day .

text: famous stepping stones 'impassable '

documents.title: five things we learned today in sheffield and south yorkshire
text: had a busy day ?
want a quick round up of what 's been going on ?
well here you are :
there will be breaking news and traffic updates through the evening and we 'll be back with more live updates from 08:00 tomorrow .
i 'll leave you with this by weather watcher rays of a robin wondering if a wise owl can help him find the way home .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: weather : cloudy this evening and overnight
text: overcast with hill fog and outbreaks of mostly light rain for much of the night .
perhaps a few cloud breaks developing in the early hours , allowing patchy fog to form .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : singer martin simpson on his musical influences
text: folk singer martin simpson will be performing his last gig of the year at firth hall in sheffield tomorrow night .
the singer dropped out of college in 1976 to follow his passion for music and released his first album , `` golden vanity '' .
in the same year .
he has been nominated 31 times for the bbc folk awards and now lives in sheffield .
he 's been telling me what inspired him when he was younger :
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: a bus with night nurses keeps drinkers safe in doncaster
text: a bus with nurses , a social worker and a mental health worker on board has been parked up in doncaster town centre for christmas revellers in need of help .
the safe haven bus will be outside doncaster 's mansion house on the high street on `` mad fridays '' in the run-up to christmas .
it 's hoped the service will help take pressure off local a & e services .
emergency attendances to doncaster royal infirmary increased by 13 % in 2015 , compared with 2013 .

documents.title: third meeting over library hotel plans
text: public demand has led to a third meeting with councillors being scheduled to discuss plans to allow a chinese consortium to take over sheffield 's central library building and turn it into a luxury hotel .
more than 10,000 people have already signed a petition about the leasing plans .
the council is pledging the graves art gallery would remain and a new library would also be built in the city centre .
the latest meeting would take place on 5 january 2017 .

documents.title: sport : rotherham 's camp not fit for fulham
text: rotherham united goalkeeper lee camp will not be fit for tomorrow 's game against fulham .
there is hope he could return for the game against sheffield wednesday on saturday .
kirk broadfoot and greg halford are also close to returning for the millers .
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: search for missing 72-year-old sheffield man
text: police in sheffield are asking for your help to find missing 72-year-old trevor everton , as concerns grow for his welfare .
trevor was last seen at about 06:30 on sunday in the burngreave area of sheffield and was reported missing yesterday evening .
he is described as being about 5ft 9ins and of large build , with a shaved head , possibly wearing a brown undercoat and black coat .

documents.title: watch : new road means faster buses between rotherham and sheffield
text: faster journey times on buses between sheffield and rotherham are promised by a £ 30m project which has opened today .
a new link has been built so traffic can avoid using junction 34 of the m1 .
it was officially opened this morning by the transport minister andrew jones .
buses running between sheffield and rotherham should be more reliable as the traffic lights favour public transport :

documents.title: watch : rotherham mother makes tearful appeal to missing son
text: the mum of a 32-year-old man missing from rotherham has made an emotional appeal for help to find her son .
daniel higgs has n't been seen since 23 november and police say he 'll be in need of his medication .
his mum janice gadsden has made a direct appeal to her son :

documents.title: bt creates 500 new customer service jobs
text: new customer service jobs are being created by bt in doncaster , amongst other places .

documents.title: transport minister unveils new south yorkshire bus service
text: transport minister andrew jones has been testing out the new bus route between sheffield and rotherham this morning .
the x1 steel link runs on a new link road over the river don and beneath tinsley viaduct .
transport minister andrew jones has opened the new sheffield - rotherham bus rapid transit road this morning .

documents.title: watch : sheffield muslims honour late pakistani singer turned preacher
text: a remembrance service has been held at sheffield 's pakistan muslim centre following the death of pakistani singer turned preacher junaid jamshed .
he died last week in an air crash that left no survivors .

jamshed gained an international audience as the vocalist with the group vital sings in the 1980s but in 2004 , jamshed officially renounced music after announcing that he had devoted his life to islam .

documents.title: platform zero opens at doncaster railway station
text: a new platform has now opened for rail passengers alighting at doncaster and it 's been given the number zero .
it will be used by trains starting and terminating in the town .
news : we 've just formally opened platform 0 at doncaster with the help of @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
howabout you formally take my complaints and refunds seriously ?
were these sent to our customer experience centre ?
2x emails to 'enquiries @ northernrailway.co.uk ' , 'advice @ transportfocus.org.uk ' , 2x delay repay forms and 2x complaint forms
hi tess , sorry to hear this , what date/s did you send these ?
first round was sent 5/12 , second batch yesterday .
our team aim to respond within 20 working days tess , if you give them a call they will be able to update you 0800 200 6060
great platform taste , zero sugar !
i have an irrational irritation at platform 0 .

documents.title: watch : barnsley remembers the dead in england 's worst mining disaster
text: a series of commemorative events are being held in barnsley to remember the 150th anniversary of england 's worst mining disaster .
two underground explosions devastated oaks colliery in 1866 .
i 've been speaking to john timms whose relative helped with the rescue :
author: James Vincent
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: barnsley man arrested over trouble at ipswich caravan site
text: a 23-year-old man from barnsley has been arrested following violent disorder at a caravan site in ipswich linked to a murder investigation .
four men and a teenager have been detained .
two men , aged 18 and 32 , are believed to have died after they were stabbed at the caravan site near the a14 on thursday .

documents.title: did you see teenage boy hit by car in sheffield last night ?
text: a collision in the hillsborough area of sheffield last night has left a teenager with life-threatening injuries .
a gold fiat punto was travelling along catch bar lane towards parkside road at about 21:30 when it struck a 15-year-old pedestrian .
the boy , who 's from sheffield , was taken to hospital where he remains .

documents.title: nurses on board 'mad friday ' bus
text: a bus with nurses and a mental health worker on board is parked up in doncaster , for christmas revellers who may have partied a bit too much .

documents.title: barnsley mp dan jarvis remembers deaths in oaks mining disaster
text: tribute paid to the 383 men who died .
150 years ago today at 1.15pm , 383 barnsley miners died in an explosion at oaks colliery - the worst mining disaster in english history 1/2
coal mines produced more than just coal .
in barnsley , we 'll never forget our mining heritage & those who served & sacrificed underground 2/2

as a tribute to the lost townsfolk
that 's great to hear - thanks for telling me .
am sure it will be brilliant .
if you have a hour between 7 & 8 i 'm sure you will be welcome , it 's a free show !

my father and grandfather - 100 years plus between them in the pits .
proud of them .

documents.title: listen : richard caborn joins calls for change at the fa
text: five former bosses at the football association have described the organisation as outdated , saying it 's full of `` elderly white men '' who block reforms .
they 're urging the government to step in and make changes , and they 've laid out their concerns in a letter to the culture , media and sport committee .
the former sports minister and former sheffield mp richard caborn , agreed change was needed :
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your photos : a misty start to the day
text: fog and mist are not always welcome when you 're a keen photographer , but these put up by south yorkshire 's weather watchers today , show they can make for an atmospheric shot .
check out this stunning view captured above the mist by wendy in stannington :
in cudworth , tom found a sunlit green field resting beneath a hazy treeline :
and dave camm found a wonderful spot to watch the sun come up in the fields just below barnburgh craggs :

documents.title: weather : rain arriving this afternoon
text: outbreaks of mostly light rain arriving from early afternoon , along with hill fog .
it will feel rather chilly everywhere .
tonight will be overcast with hill fog and outbreaks of mostly light rain at first .
overnight the rain clears away northeastwards , and perhaps a few cloud breaks develop , allowing patchy fog to form .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: new bt jobs coming to doncaster
text: telecoms giant bt is to create 500 customer service jobs across the uk mainly at contact centres in doncaster , swansea , warrington and accrington .
the jobs are in addition to a previously-announced target of 1,000 posts across the uk and ireland by the end of next march .

documents.title: barnsley remembers england 's worst ever mining disaster
text: people in barnsley will come together later today to mark 150 years since the oaks disaster - england 's worst ever mining tragedy .
on this day in 1866 , 362 men and boys descended 900ft ( 274m ) down the oaks colliery shafts .
william ward ( below ) was a volunteer rescuer who lost his father , john , in the first explosion .
he played a key role in raising money for the first memorial , which was installed in the grounds of christ church , ardsley , in 1879 .
the disaster , which killed miners and those trying to rescue them , happened after a series of explosions ripped through the workings .
a total of 383 people died , the youngest was only 10 .

documents.title: watch : doncaster provides health bus to assist drunk revellers
text: a bus is being used in doncaster to provide a safe haven for revellers who 've hurt themselves or had too much to drink .
it will be parked on high street on friday and saturday nights in the run-up to christmas .
a nurse , health care assistants , social worker and mental health professional are on board .
the hope is it 'll take pressure off a & e departments .

documents.title: travel : disruption on stradbroke road in sheffield
text: stradbroke road in woodhouse , sheffield is closed between the stradbroke drive junction and the richmond hill junction
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: £ 30m bus link between rotherham and sheffield opens
text: bus passengers travelling between rotherham and sheffield are getting a new service following completion of the £ 29.8m bus rapid transit north scheme .
the x1 steel link runs on a new tinsley link road built over the river don and under tinsley viaduct , to provide a more direct route for buses and improve congestion in the area .

documents.title: rotherham man arrested after fatal crash
text: a rotherham man has been arrested after a motorcyclist died in a crash with three other vehicles in north yorkshire .
a citroen c1 , vw jetta , a ford ranger truck and a honda motorbike collided on the a19 in selby on friday .
the motorcyclist , 24 , from goole , east yorkshire , died at the scene .

documents.title: listen : strike halts bin collections in doncaster
text: bin collectors in doncaster are on strike this morning .
the unite union says the strike is about holidays and what they describe as `` bullying '' bosses .
contractor suez says the union is taking action to try and reinstate an employee dismissed over an alleged health and safety breach .
shane sweeting from unite reckons the public will be on their side :

documents.title: orgreave files to be made public next year
text: files relating to the so-called battle of orgreave are expected to be made public in 2017 , it has been revealed .
in a letter to the home affairs select committee , the home secretary said 30 files relating to the uk miners ' strike would be sent to the national archives .
the subject titles show that at least one file relates directly to orgreave .
in october , home secretary amber rudd ruled out an inquiry into the clashes between miners and police at the coking plant on the edge of sheffield in june 1984 .

documents.title: sport : call for paul warne to stay on as millers manager
text: rotherham united captain lee frecklington has called for paul warne to remain the boss at the new york stadium after saturday 's win against qpr .
the 31-year-old would like to see warne stay in the job as caretaker rather than rotherham united find a quick replacement for kenny jackett .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : new 'platform zero ' opens at doncaster station
text: a new platform opens at doncaster railway station this morning , to be used for trains terminating or starting from the town .
it 's called platform zero , you 'll find it at the end near to the frenchgate shopping centre .
toby higgins is spokesman for network rail :

documents.title: hillsborough disaster referee claims statement was changed
text: the referee on duty at hillsborough on the day of the disaster has claimed his statement was changed to support allegations fans were drunk .
this is from an itv documentary tonight called hillsborough : smears , survivors and the search for truth .

documents.title: dancing sheffield mayor glides to success on ice
text: sheffield 's lord mayor denise fox and her husband terry fox took to the ice in front of a packed audience over the weekend performing to ravel 's bolero .
the five performances were all for charity and we think they were pretty elegant :
please donate it 's been an unbelievable experience , we 've made so many great friends .
the kids were amazing .

documents.title: watch : barnsley remembers the oaks mining disaster
text: a series of events are being held in barnsley to remember england 's worst mining disaster 150 years ago today at oaks colliery .

documents.title: watch : the full weather forecast for south yorkshire
text: starting dry with mist and any fog gradually clearing .
however , cloud will quickly thicken this morning , with outbreaks of mostly light rain arriving from early afternoon , along with hill fog .
it will feel rather chilly everywhere .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North
